title: proposal: x/net/context: Context-aware HTTP helper functions.
body:
Proposal: add a context-aware client that is similar to/mirrors `http.Client`.

```
req, _ := http.NewRequest(...)

ctx := context.Background()
c := ctxhttp.NewClient(http.DefaultClient)

// Add the ctx parameter to Do()
resp, err := c.Do(ctx, req)
```

Should this type go into `x/net/context/ctxhttp`? The package shouldn't be called `http`, since something like this would need to be used in conjunction with `net/http`.

Is `Get()`, `Post()`, etc needed, or do we only need `Do(ctx, req)`?
